header.title: The best fence installation company in Riverside
bullets: Trusted fence repair and replacement with 2000+ reviews (4.8 rating)
FREE custom quote and video call for your onsite visit
Transparent pricing and top notch craftsmanship

Yelp.description: Lhacya was able to provide support. I was looking to replace a ten foot fence I share with my neighbor. Lhacya was very patient and provided details about the project. The sales process was state of the art with 3-D images of how my new fence would look.
Yelp.name: Miguel D.
Yelp.title: The sales process was state of the art with 3-D images of how my new fence would look.

Google.description: Following my initial inquiry, I was contacted by a young lady who explained to me that they would be happy to set up a time to evaluate my requirements. We've gotten a few quotes from a variety of contractors who's level of expertise, punctuality, price and friendliness (or lack thereof) has varied widely from company to company. My first impressions of Ergeon were excellent.
Google.name: B.C
Google.title: My first impressions of Ergeon were excellent.

faq.front-yard: 6 feet (3 feet solid + 3 feet 75% open) for RA-5, RC, RR and RE zones, 4 feet (3 feet solid + 1 feet 75% open) for other zones
faq.corner-lot-rules: Max 3 feet on 15 feet triangle visibility area measured from curb lines intersections.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor.  In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
When it’s time to replace your fence, you may be asking yourself what fence style is best for you and your property.
